text: I'm Randy Harper I'm a technical
evangelist for Amazon web services in
this video I'm going to show you how to
get started with Linux web applications
in the AWS Cloud this guide will help
you to use AWS to create scalable robust
web applications that handle
sophisticated demands and
workloads we'll walk through the process
of deploying a sample Drupal application
using several key aw us services and
following best
practices it's easy to get started and
for most of the Tas ask we can use the
AWS Management console before you get
started you will need to create an AWS
account by signing up for one service
you sign up for all services you will
only be charged for the resources that
you use to sign up for AWS go to
aws.amazon.com and click sign up now
follow the onscreen
instructions AWS notifies you by email
when your account is active and
available for you to use we'll need to
install some command line tools for
autoscaling we'll do this first to
minimize our usage for our buildable
services for instructions on how to
install and set up the autoscaling
command line tools go to the autoscaling
developer guide you will install these
command line tools to your local
computer after you have installed the
command line tools try a couple of
commands to make sure they
work
